title: The Academic and Residential Complex | Campus Housing | University of Illinois at Chicago
contents: Skip to the content of this page ,  the main menu , the secondary menu , the site search form , the site home page .           Campus Housing     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Campus Housing      Campus Housing   Main Menu    FUTURE RESIDENTS           Apply    Move-In    Housing Rates    Residence Halls    Services    Why Live on Campus         CURRENT RESIDENTS           Apply    Move Out    Summer Housing    ReApp    Housing During Breaks    Housing Rates    Academic Support    Get Involved    Resident Handbook    Services         GUESTS AND CONFERENCES           Guest Housing    Medical Students    Intern Housing    Conference Housing         WORK WITH US           Professional Staff    Student Staff          Eyebrow menu    Dates to Know    Contact Us    Dock    MyContract    UIC Connection    Student Affairs    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search               View Menu            The Academic and Residential Complex  This new living-learning community located near Harrison and Morgan Streets is more than 151,000 square feet. The 10-story building provides residential accommodations for approximately 550 students in a traditional and semi-suite style environment.  Within the residential component, approximately 16,000 square feet features a fitness center, multiple social and/or gaming lounges, study lounges on each floor, laundry facilities, offices, and a tenth-floor sky lounge. The Academic & Residential Complex is LEED Gold certified by the US Green Building Council.  In addition to the residential components, the more than 50,000 square feet of academic space, includes three large lecture halls featuring “turn to team” design elements and four classrooms that enable team based learning. There are also several small group study rooms and open collaboration or individual work spaces, a tutoring center, along with computer stations, printers, and an IT helpdesk. The retail space is occupied by Starbucks.  This project is entirely financed by a private partner, American Campus Communities, in the first P3 partnership of its kind in the state of Illinois. Living Learning Communities    Honors  Pre-Law and Justice  Humanities  International Perspectives        Location & Mailing Address   Be sure to include your name, room number & letter in your address.
